title: Which river flows through the Thar Desert? - Quora

response.answer_text: Which river flows through the Thar Desert? Luni is largest river in the Thar desert in north-west India. It originates in the Pushkar valley of the Aravalli Range, near Ajmer, passes through the southeastern portion of the Thar Desert, and ends in the marshy lands of Rann of Kutch in Gujarat, after travelling a distance of 495 km (about 308 miles). It is first known as Sagarmati, then after passing Govindgarh, it meets its tributary Saraswati, which originates from Pushkar Lake, and from then on it has the name Luni.
